remarks: Inequality of arithmetic and geometric means.  Here ` ( M gsum F ) ` calculates the group sum within the multiplicative monoid of the complex numbers (or in other words, it multiplies the elements ` F ( x ) , x e. A ` together), and ` ( CCfld gsum F ) ` calculates the group sum in the additive group (i.e. the sum of the elements).  This is Metamath 100 proof #38.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
statement:
amgm.1 $e |- M = ( mulGrp ` CCfld ) $.
amgm $p |- ( ( A e. Fin /\ A =/= (/) /\ F : A --> ( 0 [,) +oo ) ) -> ( ( M gsum F ) ^c ( 1 / ( # ` A ) ) ) <_ ( ( CCfld gsum F ) / ( # ` A ) ) ) $.
